alert.note: Alert for Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 4:11AM EDT until July 20 at 4:40AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Daviess and Martin. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moving slowly east across Daviess and Martin Counties. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen since 230 am EDT. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washington, Shoals, Loogootee, Odon, Plainville, Montgomery, Cannelburg, Alfordsville, West Boggs Lake, Burns City, Glendale Fishery, Lacy and Indian Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
